txt.en: 'I can hardly believe that Narsil has been remade, but the feel of Andúril in my hand quells all my doubt! This night has been long in coming, [placeholder], and I marvel at it!'
'Let us return to the House of Elrond. Many are the friends that wait within, and I would show them Andúril that they may know what has been done this night.'
Instance: The Blade That Was Broken
'I know that Aragorn has long hoped this night would come and feared that it would not. At last, the sword has been reforged!'
Aragorn is waiting to speak with you just outside the forges of Rivendell.\n\nElf-smiths are reforging Narsil, the blade that was broken.
At the forges of Rivendell, the Elf-smiths of Elrond are hard at work remaking the sword of the kings.\n\nElf-smiths have begun the work of reforging Narsil.
Aragorn is at the forges of Rivendell.\n\nAragorn wishes to speak with you.
'For long hours we have toiled, over fire hot and metal cold.'
'Behold Andúril, Flame of the West!'
'The last of the Silithair has given the blade the glow it had of old.'
'From the ashes a fire is woken.'
'A new blade has been beaten from the shards of Narsil.'
'I thank you, my friends. The blade that was broken has been remade, and my heart dares to hope.'
'The work is nearly finished.'
'It is time, my friend. Let us see how goes the forging.'
'Lord Elrond, it is ready.'
'Hold on, hold on! One moment!'
'This blade is called Andúril, the Flame of the West.'
'Come now, Gandalf! Must you always be so gloomy? This is a time for cheer!'
'It was forged from the shards of Narsil and from it springs the light of the last Silithar.'
'Hello, uncle.'
'Take it with honour, Aragorn, for it is thine.'
'It will take more than swords to turn this tide, Aragorn, even one such as this.'
Witness the reforging of Narsil
'A time for some cheer, perhaps, but not to excess! Dark dangers press upon us! Evil stirs!'
'If you will stop with your chattering, Bilbo Baggins, perhaps you will have your answer!'
'It is true that our roads wind into danger, but I rejoice that I walk them in friendship with all of you.'
'Do not despair, my friends! We will brave the stormclouds on the horizon.'
'You might have come to get me, Dúnadan!'
The Elf-smiths of Elrond have begun to reforge Narsil, the blade that was broken, an heirloom of Elendil's line.
'I didn't think the sword would be ready until tomorrow!'
'But, Gandalf, the sword of the King has been remade!'
'Come, Aragorn.'
'Hullo, Frodo!'
'That has to count for something, surely!'
'Look! Hemeldir has something to say!'
'Well, I haven't missed anything songworthy yet, have I?'
'You have my greetings, Aragorn son of Arathorn, Lord of the Dúnedain!'
'Many years have passed since I gave unto you the shards of Narsil, heirloom of your line.'
'You are right, Frodo. I am sorry. I did not mean to be... gloomy.'
'This night will see its light rekindled. The blade that was broken....'

'Are you ready, [placeholder]? The air tonight feels full of promise, and I have resolved to leave any doubts I have behind me. For Narsil to be reforged this night feels unreal to me, as if I will wake in the House of Elrond and find this has all been a dream.'
